dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 3095 RH: Fair and Open Skies Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. DeFazio (for himself, Mr. Larsen of Washington, Ms. Davids of Kansas, Mr. Lamb, Mr. Kahele, Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois, Mr. Ferguson, Mr. Bacon, Mr. Bergman, and Mr. Johnson of Ohio) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Additional sponsors: Ms. Norton, Ms. Jackson Lee, Mr. Bost, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Carbajal, Ms. Chu, Mr. Connolly, Ms. Wilson of Florida, Ms. Brownley, Mr. Gallego, Mrs. Trahan, Mr. Welch, Mr. Sherman, Ms. DeGette, Mr. Emmer, Mr. Kim of New Jersey, Mr. Pappas, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. Aguilar, Ms. McCollum, Mr. McKinley, Mr. Van Drew, Mr. Ruppersberger, Mr. Reschenthaler, Miss Rice of New York, Ms. Barragán, Mr. Huffman, Ms. Wexton, Mr. Pallone, Mr. Peters, Mr. Thompson of California, Mr. Payne, Mr. Kind, Mr. Hern, Mr. Crow, Ms. Wild, Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Mr. Smith of New Jersey, Ms. Sánchez, Mr. Lowenthal, Mr. Cartwright, Mr. Levin of California, Mr. Norcross, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Ruiz, Mr. Nadler, Mr. Perlmutter, Mr. Mrvan, Mr. Pascrell, Mr. Brendan F. Boyle of Pennsylvania, Mrs. Axne, Mr. Kinzinger, Mr. Sires, Mr. Garamendi, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Cárdenas, Mr. Malinowski, Ms. Ross, Ms. Pingree, Ms. Spanberger, Ms. Blunt Rochester, Mr. Smith of Washington, Mr. Gottheimer, Mr. Allen, Mr. Courtney, Mr. Turner, Mr. Allred, Mr. Cleaver, Mr. Neguse, Mr. Higgins of New York, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Mr. Pocan, Mr. Joyce of Ohio, Mr. Schrader, Mrs. Watson Coleman, Mr. García of Illinois, Ms. DeLauro, Ms. DelBene, Ms. Stefanik, Mr. Nehls, Mr. Katko, Mr. Lawson of Florida, Mr. Zeldin, Mr. Foster, Mr. Carson, Mr. Lynch, Mr. Valadao, Mr. Gibbs, Mr. Neal, Ms. Meng, Mr. Fortenberry, Mr. Krishnamoorthi, Mr. Evans, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Ryan of Ohio, Mr. Swalwell, Mr. Brady, Mrs. Luria, Mr. Kildee, Ms. Kuster, Mrs. Fletcher, Mr. Stauber, Mr. Garbarino, Mr. Levin of Michigan, Mr. Suozzi, Ms. Garcia of Texas, Ms. Malliotakis, Mr. Takano, Ms. Bonamici, Mrs. Beatty, Mr. Ellzey, Mr. Case, Ms. Schakowsky, Mr. Moolenaar, Ms. Jayapal, Mr. Bishop of Georgia, Mr. Jeffries, Mr. Gomez, Mr. Hollingsworth, Mr. Cicilline, Ms. Clark of Massachusetts, Ms. Strickland, Mr. Vicente Gonzalez of Texas, Mrs. Hartzler, Ms. Roybal-Allard, Mrs. Napolitano, Mr. Burgess, Mr. Costa, Ms. Porter, Mr. Delgado, Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York, Mr. Vargas, Mr. Brooks, Mr. DeSaulnier, Ms. Sewell, Ms. Castor of Florida, Ms. Schrier, Ms. Craig, Mrs. Lawrence, Mr. Veasey, Mr. Stanton, Ms. Williams of Georgia, Ms. Manning, Mr. Moulton, Ms. Dean, Mr. Soto, Mr. Casten, Mr. Tiffany, Mr. Waltz, Mr. Gooden of Texas, Mr. Espaillat, and Ms. Brown of Ohio
Reported from the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To ensure that authorizations issued by the Secretary of Transportation to foreign air carriers do not undermine labor rights or standards, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fair and Open Skies Act.

section.header: Foreign air transportation under United States-European Union air transport agreement
section.text: The Secretary of Transportation may not issue a permit under section 41302 of title 49, United States Code, or an exemption under section 40109 of such title, authorizing a person to provide foreign air transportation as a foreign air carrier under the United States-European Union Air Transport Agreement of April 2007 (as amended), unless the Secretary—

paragraph.text: finds that issuing the permit or exemption would be consistent with Article 17 bis of the Agreement; and
imposes on the permit or exemption such conditions as may be necessary to ensure that the person complies with Article 17 bis.

section.text: Section 41302(2) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A) by striking under an agreement with the United States Government; or and inserting ; and; and

in subparagraph (B) by striking the foreign air transportation and inserting after considering the totality of the circumstances, including the factors set forth in section 40101(a), the foreign air transportation.

subsection.text: Section 40101(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: preventing entry into United States markets by flag of convenience carriers.
preventing the undermining of labor standards.

subsection.text: Section 40101(e)(9) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (D) by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (E) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Section 40102(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (21) through (47) as paragraphs (22) through (48), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (20) the following:
flag of convenience carrier means a foreign air carrier that is established in a country other than the home country of its majority owner or owners in order to avoid regulations of the home country.

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
